page.title: 11Taddington Institute
page.content: The building was a cowshed converted into a Men's Social Club about eighty years ago.They played billiards and read newspapers.They were allowed to smoke but not any alcohol. When the village had a band it practised there. When we had cricket and football teams they also met there.We again have a Youth Club which meets on Tuesdays. A doctor's surgery is held on Thursdays at noon.The Old People's Club meets once a fortnight.Once a month the W.I. meets there as also does the Parish Council.Keep Fit and Aerobic classes for women are held on Mondays and Wednesdays.Whist Drives,Jumble Sales, Hot-pot Suppers and the occasional Disco are held in it.The committee needs Â£30 000 to replace the wooden extension with a permanent structure and for new toilets and kitchen.It has to raise Â£10 000 and hope for grants..
